Posts.Content: Hi Yvonne I'm good thanks, hope you're doing well. Not much else for it "onwards & upwards". Booked a holiday flying out to Egypt on 3rd November for a week in the sun - need to try & lose a bit of this weight before I go. It certainly helps with the SE's to share & hear other peoples experiences.  In October I am doing a course called Breast Cancer Moving Forward run by Breast Cancer Care which my consultant thinks will help with understanding the fatigue as this is the thing I struggle with most - eyes closing as I type. Keep in touch. E x
Posts.Title: Letrozole are dreadful

Posts.Content: Hi Yvonne I started Letrozole in Dec 2012 and have stiff joints especially my lower back and knees, I have terrible hot flushes which I have had for years but now ten fold, weight gain (2.5 stone) and the most difficult side effect for me is the fatigue - I was slim & fit before my health problems in my 50th year. When it gets me down and it does, as I feel half the person I was before - I remember that my oncologist offered sympathy re the side effects but said "Elaine you are on a wonderful drug" and this is what pulls mw through.  E x
Posts.Title: Letrozole are dreadful

Posts.Content: Has anyone else been put on Letrozole as a first treatment and if so how successful has it been. I cant have surgery just now as im on Warfarin and my consutant says I should be more worried about my blood clots (I had bilateral pulmonary embolism) than my cancer diagnosis - I was prescribed Letrozole on 28th Dec and have a follow-up appointment on 8th Feb to see if the drug is doing its job and shrinking my hormone receptive tumour in my left breast. As time goes on I am finding it more difficult to keep the positivity going. Elaine
Posts.Title: Letrozole as 1st treatment

Posts.Content: Thx for your thoughts Mistymoley & Jen, I'll update you when I get results - feel I need to wait until Tuesday then if I've not heard I can phone BCN. Going for a bone density scan tomorrow morning- between working & medical appointments which are keeping me busy this is best for me as my thoughts can grow arms & legs if I dwell on things. Stomach always the first to be affected so looking forward to having an appetite again.  E x
Posts.Title: Awaiting results - recurrence

Posts.Content: Hi I had WLE & radiotherapy 2013 - 5 years Letrozole, went for my yearly mammogram a few weeks ago- got lettered to say there were changes they wanted to look at. Had a repeat mammogram where they used 2 different paddles fitted to the machine so they could have more detailed images of the changes- in the area of my scar, I had this a week past on Tuesday- still no results, radiologist said I would hear from my consultant within 2 weeks- I am now frantic- but friends are trying to comfort me by saying no news is good news, I just really want to know. Has anyone else waited this long, is this normal. Thx E x
Posts.Title: Awaiting results - recurrence

Posts.Content: Thx for your thoughts Mistymoley & Jen, I'll update you when I get results - feel I need to wait until Tuesday then if I've not heard I can phone BCN. Going for a bone density scan tomorrow morning- between working & medical appointments which are keeping me busy this is best for me as my thoughts can grow arms & legs if I dwell on things. Stomach always the first to be affected so looking forward to having an appetite again.  E x
Posts.Title: Awaiting results - recurrence

Posts.Content: My consultant sat me down in November and gave me a harsh talking to, she said I am far too hard on myself and felt I really needed to accept what had happened to me (Bilateral pulmonary embolism followed by a breast cancer diagnosis 2 months later while I was still ill from the PE's) and said you will probably never go back to what you were before and it was reall about me accepting this, I have been referred to a Breast Cancer Moving Forward course which she hopes will help me - us women are good at being hard on ourselves,  she made me sit up and realise this is not going to be a quick fix. We are all in the same boat and it helps to talk to ladies going through the same. E x
Posts.Title: When will I be "ME" again ???

Posts.Content: I'm sorry a few of you girls have been refused Femara - I persevered with Letrozole for just over 2 years & presented a case to my consultant who said it would need to be my GP that agreed as it was his budget- thankfully my GP agreed & within 2 weeks I had a spark of energy I had not felt for 2 years- still a bit stiff in the morning & knees still stuff but so much easier to cope with without the fatigue. if it helps I asked if I could try it for a couple of months & said I would honestly tell him if it made no difference- but alas it did & I'm so grateful. Thanks great post George. Elaine
Posts.Title: Aromatase Inhibitors - All Brands of The 4 Hormonal Therapy Table...

Posts.Content: Hi G Yes very grateful that my GP agreed & it was through the info I got from this group I was able to present a case for Femara & I thank the Lord everyday. I'm awaiting a CT scan regarding pulmonary fibrosis & I will update you when I see consultant again. Thank you for remembering- very touching. Just another wee backward step but at least my head's in a much better place now, no longer fighting to be exactly like the old me, still me just a different me. Hoping you & your good lady are doing well.  Elaine x
Posts.Title: Aromatase Inhibitors - All Brands of The 4 Hormonal Therapy Table...

Posts.Content: I have just this weekend changed from Letrozole to original generic drug Femara (which is much more expensive) - I have persevered for 2 years with the Letrozole but my quality of life has been terrible with SE's - my GP has offered to change for 2 months to see if I notice a difference - I am 3 days into Femara & I'm honestly frightened to say out loud, incase I tempt fate, my joints feel a lot less stiff. Plead your case with your GP that's what I did & I cried genuine tears when I spoke to him. I done all the research myself & please be assured they won't offer you a more expensive replacement if you battle on & don't tell them how you are feeling. Hope your GP listens to you. E x
Posts.Title: GP will not give me Arimidex on Nhs

Posts.Content: I get up in the morning and go through my normal routine (takes much longer than usual) - I shower, straighten my hair and put on my bronzer, mascara & lippy and If I hear it once I hear it 100 times "Oh you look so well for everything you have come through", I honestly feel like saying "really try walking in my shoes and see how I'm feeling".  It really is only the people I am very close to that notice the dark circles and tiredness that shows in my eyes.  My son finds it hard to accept he once had a mum who ran around 100 MPH and now comes in from work, makes/eats dinner and does very little else - he gets worried if he sees me lying down but I just ask him to look at my eyes and ask do I look tired and he says yes and then he understands better. Maybe you should say to your sister that she should try walking in your shoes and see how it feels - this journey is difficult enough without dealing with people who can't or won't believe that fatigue is an ongoing issue. Stay strong honey. E x
Posts.Title: help feel awful at 2 radiotherapy to go

Posts.Content: Hi I wouldn't chance a flu jab as I've been on Letrozole since Dec 2012 & defo affects my immunity, seem to be picking up lots of colds some of which have ended in a chest infection. Hope this helps. E
Posts.Title: Letrozole tablets and side affects

Posts.Content: I was diagnosed on 28th Dec after being told a week before the consultant was 90% sure he knew what he was dealing with. It's not easy. I'm on Warfarin as I had blood clots on both lungs they can't give me surgery just now so on Letrozole to hopefully shrink the tumour. Try your best to be positive. In my thoughts. Elaine
Posts.Title: Newly diagnosed - feeling lost

Posts.Content: Alison Do what I do now, ask for help.  1st time's the hardest, escpecially when you have beed used to being independent. E x
Posts.Title: I need 4 arms !!!

Posts.Content: Just an update - been on femara 10 days & feeling like I have some energy which I haven't had since going on Letrozole over 2 years ago, only joint pain is a bit on my shoulders which is a marked improvement again as it was my lower back, hips & knees while taking the Letrozole - I have been put on Venalefaxine for the hot flushes & seems to be keeping them at bay - early days but feeling hopeful, My GP has given me 2 months supply to try - just hoping if improvements continue he will agree to change for my prescribed time. Will keep the post updated. E x
Posts.Title: Letrozole V Femara

Posts.Content: Have been suffering life changing SE of Letrozole, started taking Dec 2012 for 5 years for left breast 19mm grade 2 breast cancer but getting vibes it may now be 10 years.  Had an appointment with consultant last Friday and having read a lot of discussion regarding changes to SE depending on brand - I asked if it was possible to get changed to Femara, GP agreed to try so started last night and hoping and praying I notice a difference as I feel about 100 years old - coping with hot flushes but joint pain & fatigue are extreme. Has anyone else gone down this route to alleviate side effects of Letrozole. Thanks ladies. Elaine
Posts.Title: Letrozole V Femara

Posts.Content: Thanks for the replies Stoksie/Sally/Dreamthief GP has given me 2 months to try & I have read it takes around a month for Letrozole to leave the system - as you know they both have the same ingredient but it would seem a lot of the SE's are more to do with the fillers that brands use.  I know that it's the lack of oestrogen that causes hot flushes, joint pain & fatigue but I am completely miserable.  Waiting to go for yearly mammograms & bone density which I had done 2 years ago & was fine.  I am taking Cod Liver Oil & calcium. I already have arthrtis in both knees but worse on left & it became quite unstable & much sorer just before Christmas - it was while getting results of X ray I plucked up the courage to ask for Femara.  I could cope with knee pain that has been ongoing for a couple of years (thanks to my hillwalking I fear) if my SE's were less.  I will post back results in a month or so. Elaine x
Posts.Title: Letrozole V Femara

Posts.Content: Hi I was the same with Letrozole & done some research where I discovered Femara the generic brand had far fewer side effects than Letrozole. I presented a case to my breast consultant after taking it for a year & she said it was my GP's budget but if he didn't allow me to have it to let her know & she would back up my case. My GP agreed so I had 3 months trial & it was like night & day. Still some flushes but fatigue much better & I didn't wake up like the tin man in the morning.  Perhaps ask your consultant to contact your GP. Good luck.
Posts.Title: Letrozole V Femara

Posts.Content: That's rubbish you need to pay, I put a case to my GP on the benefits of Femara & he let me try it for 3 months - the difference was unbelievable so he kept prescribing it. E x
Posts.Title: Letrozole V Femara

Posts.Content: Hi Sandi I too had a lump/hardness under my lumpectomy scar - my oncologist booked me in for an ultrasound & the radiologist ended up doing a biopsy which thankfully came back as fatty necrosis which I believe is scar tissue.  I'm sure yours will be the same but best to get it checked out. I was told to gently massage it to help it disperse and it is getting much softer. Take Care E x
Posts.Title: Lump under lumpectomy scar query
